data.title: TCU Tuition Information
data.meta_description: Calculating the price of attending TCU, consider the quality of the investment. A TCU education delivers next-generation academics through personal attention, along with opportunities for leadership and real-world experience, and great return in personal fulfillment and professional achievement.
data.text:
Main Content

As you consider schools, also consider the quality of the investment you’re making. If you choose the right college, the return in personal fulfillment and professional achievement can be great.

TCU’s tuition is several thousand dollars lower than most institutions of comparable quality and selectivity, and the value of a TCU education is growing. New and renovated facilities house cutting-edge academic programs and exciting ways to get involved.

Amid these changes, the hallmarks of a TCU education remain: the strengths and choices of a major university, the personal attention of a small college, opportunities for leadership and real-world experience.

Undergraduate Cost

Direct Costs for Fall 2024-Spring 2025 Tuition based on 12-18 hours of enrollment for fall and spring semesters $61,650 Student Government Association (required of all students) $90 Housing and Food for students living On-Campus $16,700 Housing / Typical first-year rate: $10,400 Food / Cost for a basic meal plan: $6,300 Book and supply costs vary by student. This is an estimated amount for the average TCU student. $800

Total Fall and Spring Estimated Direct Cost $79,240

Indirect Costs for Fall 2024-Spring 2025 Travel expenses $1,320 Miscellaneous personal expenses $4,422 Average loan fees (when borrowing) $68

Direct Costs for Fall 2024-Spring 2025 Tuition based on 12-18 hours of enrollment for fall and spring semesters $61,650 Student Government Association (required of all students) $90 Housing and Food for students living Off-Campus $16,700 Book and supply costs vary by student. This is an estimated amount for the average TCU student. $800

This is an estimated amount for the average TCU student. $800

Total Fall and Spring Estimated Direct Cost $65,980

Direct Costs for Fall 2024-Spring 2025 Tuition based on 12-18 hours of enrollment for fall and spring semesters $61,650 Student Government Association (required of all students) $90 Housing and Food $16,700 Housing / Typical first-year rate: $10,400 Food / Cost for a basic meal plan: $6,300 Health Insurance $2,204 Book and supply costs vary by student. This is an estimated amount for the average TCU student. $800
